Name: Dm-crypt / LUKS
File: <ref>dm-crypt can encrypt a file-based volume when used with the losetup utility included with all major Linux distributions</ref>
Hibernation file: <ref>yes  but the user needs custom scripts: http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/slackware-14/luks-encryption-swap-and-hibernate-627958/</ref>

Name: e-Capsule Private Safe
File: <ref>Uses proprietary e-Capsule file system not exposed to the OS.</ref>

Name: FileVault
Swap space: <ref name=not-technically-filevault>not technically part of FileVault  but provided by many versions of Mac OS X; can be enabled independently of FileVault</ref><ref name=nsa-vilefault/>

Name: GBDE
File: <ref name=mdconfig>File-based volume encryption is possible when used with mdconfig(8) utility.</ref>

Name: Softraid / RAID C
Swap space: (encrypted by default in OpenBSD)<ref>http://www.openbsd.org/plus38.html OpenBSD 3.8 change notes</ref>

Name: TrueCrypt
Whole disk: <ref>however  not Windows UEFI-based computers with a GUID partition table (GPT)</ref>
